availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Chartered in 1848 by a special act in Frankfort. Purchased road between Lexington and Frankfort to lay railroad line. Work completed in 1851. Consolidated with the Lexington & Frankfort Railroad in 1857 to become the Louisville, Frankfort, & Lexington Railroad, which eventually became a division of the Louisville & Nashville Railroad system. Initial Board of Directors were Benjamin Gratz, Francis K. Hunt, Richard Pindell, and Edward P. Johnson of Lexington.

ab.bibl: J.H. Battle, Kiffin, G.C., Perrin, W.H., Kentucky: History of the State, Embracing A Concise Account of the Origin and Development of the Virginia Colony; Its Expansion Westward, and the Settlement of the Frontier Beyond the Alleghenies; The Erection of Kentucky As An Independent State, and Its Subsequent Development, 7th edition (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battery and Company, 1887), 524-526. “Lexington and Frankfort Railroad,” LEXHistory http://lexhistory.org/wikilex/lexington-frankfort-railroad (accessed June 11, 2019).
